“We deserve to know what we’re building and we deserve a say in these significant decisions.” The letter also voiced support for efforts by Amnesty International, which on Tuesday unveiled its own petition calling on Google “not capitulate to China's censorship demands.”

— Google again grapples with employee uproar: A company spokesperson reiterated in a statement that the work on a Chinese search engine is “exploratory” and is “not close to launching a search product in China,” echoing prior remarks.

Transitions

— Elena Hernandez, press secretary for the House Committee on Energy and Commerce, is joining the White House’s Office of Science and Technology Policy in the same role … Deborah Hersman, CEO and president of the National Safety Council, is joining Waymo as its first chief safety officer, and Amee Chande will become the company’s first chief commercial officer, after serving as managing director of global strategy and operations for Alibaba.

In a memo to Facebook staffers earlier this month made public on Tuesday, former strategic partnerships manager Mark Luckie said the company “is failing its black employees and its black users.” After Luckie posted an exchange in which vice president of partnerships Ime Archibong voiced frustration over the memo, criticism of the company spilled over online.
